Nerangs.ab: srōšdrōn bun kardan drōn ud gōšudāg ēsm ud bōy 3 tāg ānōh nihādan ud pad srōšdrōn hamāg gyāg sāzišn harw čis-ē xūb bē nigerišn tā srōšdrōn xwardan ā-š hōm ud wars ud urwarām az barsom ō pahrezišn ka nē pad nigerišn abar rasēd ā-šāyēd

"He should start the Srōšdrōn. He should put there in place the drōn and the gōšudāg and three pieces of ēsm and bōy. During the Srōš Drōn he has to gaze carefully at the implements at all passages until the partaking of the drōn. He has to keep the hōm and the wars and the urwarām away from the barsom. When they do come into contact without noticing it, then it is allowed."

srōšdrōn bun kardan drōn ud gōšudāg ud ēsm ud bōy 3 tāg ānōh nihādan ud frasast aziš kār-ē nēst srōšdrōn pad bun pad āsāyišn (?) harw tis-ē bē nigerišn tā srōšdrōn xwardan ā-š wars ud abzār az barsom ō pahrezišn ka-š abar rasēd ā-šāyēd hōm kamistīh 3 tāg urwarām pārag-ē nihādan

"He should start the Srōšdrōn. He should put there in place the drōn and the gōšudāg and three pieces of ēsm and bōy. There is no need of any frasast. At the beginning of the Srōš Drōn, he has to gaze calmly and carefully at the implements until the partaking of the drōn. He should keep the wars and the tools away from the barsom. When they come into contact, it is allowed. He should put in place at least three twigs of hōm and one piece of urwarām..."

Quotations.ab: N28.36 (cf. Kotwal and Kreyenbroek, 2003: pp. 92-93) (Mss. 40, 2030 (sec.m., marg.), 2106):
pad srōš-drōn drōn ud gōšūdag ān gyāg be nihišn frasast kār nēst u-š ēsm bōy sē tāg az kust ī dašn be nihišn u-š pad āsāyišn-ē harw tis-ē be nigērišn ka āsāyišn-ē ast be nē nigērēd
"In the Srōš Drōn he has to put in place the drōn and the gōšudag. There is no need of frasast. He has to put three (sets of?) pieces of ēsm ud bōy on the right side."
tā srōšdrōn xwardan wars ud hōmīzag az barsom ōh pahrēzišn ka abar rasēd ā šāyēd
"Until the partaking of the srōšdrōn he has to keep apart the wars and the hōmīzag from the barsom. When they come into contact, it is allowed."

ModernPractice.ab: "The assistant priest puts the consecrated bread with the ghee on the table and sets 3 (pieces of) wood (and) incense on the stone near the fire urn. The chief priest inspects the Paragnā (set up) and taking water from the water container, pours (it) on the bundle. Both (priests) recite."

"This service is an integral part of the Yasna, and is not identical to the sacred bread service (drōn yasht) performed as a distinct and separate ceremony. In the separate drōn service in honor of Srōsh, six unleavened pieces of bread are consecrated, one having a cube of clarified butter (ghee) on it. In the Yasna service (which can be dedicated to any spirit being [yazad]) there is only one piece of unleavened sacred bread, cut with nine marks, with a cube of ghee on it. Another difference is that in the Yasna the term srōsh drōn is applied not only to the recitation, but also to the sacred bread cake itself. [...]

At this point in the ritual, namely, the beginning of Y3, the priest must make sure that the drōn is on the ritual table, the hōm and pmegranate twigs, and the goat's milk all arranged properly, and four ēsm-bōy placed on the two small stone blocks beside the fire. (cf. Meherjirana, 1941:33). All these organic ritual instruments (ālāt) will be consecrated in the srōsh drōn." [cf. N28.36]
